page.title: 03FARMING-BARNACLE NR COVENTRY
page.content: {Park Farm}is on the outskirts of {Barnacle.}It is built of{brick}and {tile}on a stone base.This stone plinth was the foundation of an earlier farmhouse, reputed to have been burnt down during the{Civil war}.The remains of a moat also suggest an interesting historical past.The farm currently comprises 138 acres of{grassland},25 acres of{winter wheat}and 5 acres of {turnips}.40% of the grassland is used for{grazing},the remainder is mown for {silage}.The farm is typical of local farms in that it specialises in one main aspect of agriculture,-in this case dairy farming.There are 110 milk cows on the farm,and 20 heifers in calf,but no beef cattle.Neighbouring farms also concentrate on one form of livestock or type of crop,dependent on the size of farm,soil mtype,etc.
